sentences.en: Father-of-three Mr England, who works as a RHS horticulturalist and lives in Lockleaze, Bristol, was stunned because wild squirrels are usually highly secretive animals.
sentences.cn: 史蒂夫·英格兰先生有三个孩子，他是皇家园艺学会的园艺师，目前居住在布里斯托尔的Lockleaze。 当时他被眼前的情景惊呆了，因为通常情况下，野生松鼠的行踪高度诡秘。

sentences.en: Grandpa got his horticulturalist certificate when he was 20.
sentences.cn: 爷爷20岁的时候就考到园艺师证书了.

sentences.en: I'm a professional horticulturalist, and I'm excited about the topic of ornamenting one's garden and teaching others how best to accomplish this.
sentences.cn: 我是专业的园艺家，我对装饰花园，及教导别人如何完成装饰花园等主题，十分感兴趣。

sentences.en: The progress of the bloom was checked closely by museum horticulturalist Zac Stayton.
sentences.cn: 博物馆的园艺学家扎克•斯泰顿严密监测着开花的过程。

trans.tran_cn: 园艺种植者；（尤指）园艺（学）家
trans.tran_en: A horticulturalist is a person who grows flowers, fruit, and vegetables, especially as their job
